flow.descriptionCdata:
e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.051ef360-d095-4315-b467-b5abec1772c9.prompt=UsernamePrompt\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.30b88308-93f8-4f37-94c3-785c711af5fe.prompt=Port\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.46e93fb4-b053-40f5-91c3-342043ee2651.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.472a8d39-61b4-4e8c-8e73-dffb09a2c213.prompt=Protocol\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.5e5be9e0-70f9-4d3a-b8ae-343f2c42d2fc.prompt=PrivateKeyFile\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.8716d101-7f2e-476a-a660-acc2c8e0a9f8.prompt=OutputPath\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.8cc34465-9467-48f7-b9c5-6ca45222c90c.prompt=SasHostUsername\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.90a9474b-5fcc-4df9-a207-246cfe29de6f.prompt=HostName\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.91afc0e1-ceca-4464-b821-635e02be6cf9.prompt=Password e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.994a2154-0cb2-4e85-bfa2-2fd6e4828d5c.prompt=Target\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.ba62e1b2-00d6-4f76-b9c0-32d40b75b1d7.prompt=SasHost\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.bb382423-3d8e-48b1-b317-a5e8de2d8bf9.prompt=PasswordPrompt\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.beb1b99f-5e75-4172-b033-d20bb826254b.prompt=UserName\: e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.description=
Pings a host from a solaris system.

Inputs\:
host - the host to perform the ping from.
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty (may mangle stdout and stderr if set to true)
username - username to connect as
password - password
port - port number for connecting to the host
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local)
pty\:  (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
target - the host to ping.
packetSize - the size of packets to send to target.
packets - the number of packets to send to target.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
outputPath - network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default, the path will have to be  changed on Windows 2000 systems

Returns\:
The raw output of the ping command.

Extra Results\:
address - actual IP address pinged
%PacketLoss - The percentage of packets that ping replies were received for.
averageLatency - The average ping response time in milliseconds.
maxLatency - The maximum response time of all the pings (in milliseconds).
minLatency - the minimum number of milliseconds it took to receive a ping response.
stddevLatency - standard deviation from the result
returnCode - operation return code

Responses\:
success - ping completed successfully.
diagnosed - target did not respond to ping.
failure - target could not be pinged.
e8d1a81f-784f-4122-9faa-f181bd9ad936.fdf39939-4dac-426a-aae0-f44fbb0c90d7.description=
Runs a command and allows user to specify that it runs locally (in this case no port should be specified), via ssh, Global Shell, ROSH, Telnet, or RSH.

Input Parameters\:
host - hostname or ip address
port - port number for connecting to the host
username - username to connect as
password - password
protocol - the protocol used to run the command (can be one of ssh, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, local)
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete
command - the command to execute
arguments - the arguments to pass to the command
environment - specifies environment variables/values that need to be defined when running command
startDir - the path to the starting directory
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
sasHost - the host we want to run the ROSH command on
sasHostUsername - the username used to run the ROSH command on sasHost
usernamePrompt - the prompt that when seen should send the username
passwordPrompt - the prompt that when given should send the password
outputPath - network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this     path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default, the path will have to be  changed on Windows 2000 systems

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Extra Results\:
stdErr - the STDERR of the command
stdOut - the STDOUT of the command
flow.name: Ping

scriptlet.name: Step Remote Command in Flow Ping (84571ed8-ec70-4893-9c63-7702e7dc7151)
